SENT.plain: Maturity onset diabetes of the young (MODY) is a heterogeneous group of disorders that result in Î²-cell dysfunction
It is rare, accounting for just 1%-2% of all diabetes
It is often misdiagnosed as type 1 or type 2 diabetes, as it is often difficult to distinguish MODY from these two forms
However, diagnosis allows appropriate individualized care, depending on the genetic etiology, and allows prognostication in family members
In this review, we discuss features of the common causes of MODY, as well as the treatment and diagnosis of MODY
